newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus cabbies temporarily seal off airport.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus cabbies temporarily seal off airport.

text.p: Dozens of holidaymakers arriving in Cyprus on Wednesday were forced to haul their luggage and hitch lifts after striking taxi drivers blocked vehicle access to Larnaca airport, witnesses said.

Taxi drivers who work at the airport, on the island's southeast coast, blocked access in the evening to taxis coming in from other areas to protest the government's intention to issue some 250 more taxi licences in the district, their representatives said.
Witnesses said around 30 drivers had blocked access to the airport, but departed around midnight after receiving official assurances the licensing issue would be reviewed by the authorities.
"Tourists with young children were forced to push their luggage trolleys a kilometre up the road in the hope that a passing car would stop," he added.
Around two million tourists visit Cyprus each year, and the industry represents about 18 percent of the island's gross national product.
